intro: Gilia rigidula subsp. insignis, commonly known as the stiff gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of small, showy pink or purple flowers. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. The subspecies insignis is distinguished by its more rigid stem structure and slightly different flower morphology compared to other subspecies of Gilia rigidula.
